alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 4:26PM EDT until June 12 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast North Carolina, including the following county, Brunswick. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 423 PM EDT, Radar indicates heavy rain is still falling in central Brunswick County, which has already received up to 3 inches today. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Parents should keep children away from running water in ditches and culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boiling Spring Lakes, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Mill Creek, Winnabow and Bolivia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
